John buys 15 ounces of silver and twice as much gold. The silver costs $6 per ounce. The gold is 7 times more expensive per ounce. How much does he spend on everything?
Tom buys 7 shares of a stock that costs 15 each. He sells 7 of those shares for 11 each. The rest of the shares end up doubling in value. How much profit does he make?
Kate bought 15 packs of red bouncy balls and 14 packs of yellow bouncy balls. Each pack contained 5 bouncy balls. How many more red bouncy balls than yellow bouncy balls did Kate buy?

Aaron is gathering can lids to take to the recycling center. He uses 5 equal-sized boxes of canned tomatoes and adds the lids he gets to the 11 can lids he already has. He is now taking 5 can lids to the recycling center. How many cans lids did he get from each box?

The class plans to take a field trip to the 11. The cost to rent a 9 is 13. The cost of admission is 8 per student. The 8 is allowed in for free. If the class has a budget of 9, how many students can go on the field trip?
Mr. 14 bought 7 times as many toys for his younger son as he bought for his elder son. If the elder son received 9 toys, how many toys did Mr. 14 buy?

It takes 14 minutes for 15 to go to 5. From 5, 15 has to walk back to the 6 and it takes 12 minutes. When 15 arrives there, 15 will have been gone from the 6 9 minutes altogether. If 15 had walked to the 14 from the 6 before taking the 14 minute walk to 5, how long is the walk from 6 to the 14?
Alfred is storing a 12 of 5 each month for the next 11 years. If 8 are stolen and 5 are given to him as a donation, how many 5 does he have at the end of the 11 years.

Jenna is planning a road trip. She plans on driving the first 5 miles, and her friend will drive the last 14 miles. They plan on taking 8 13-minute breaks. If Jenna drives 13 miles per hour and her friend drives 7 miles per hour, how many hours will they spend on the road trip?
In a newspaper, each one of 15 pages holds 14 photos and each of another 10 pages hold 14 photos. How many photos are used in the newspaper?

A carnival snack booth made 12 selling popcorn each day. It made 14 times as much selling cotton candy. For a 7-day activity, the booth has to pay 14 rent and 6 for the cost of the ingredients. How much did the booth earn for 7 days after paying the rent and the cost of ingredients?

Carlos has some gold quarters. If he spends them in a store, they are worth the regular amount. If he melts them down, he can get $12 per ounce. Each quarter weighs 15 of an ounce. How many times more money would he get from melting them down instead of spending them in a store?
There were 8 dollars in the cookie jar. Doris spent 8 from the cookie jar. Martha spent half as much as Doris. How much money, in dollars, was left in the cookie jar?

Emily bought 15 packs of candy necklaces to give her classmates at school for Valentine’s Day. Each pack had 7 candy necklaces in it. Emily opened one pack at a time. After her classmates took as many as they wanted, there were 14 candy necklaces left. How many packs did Emily open for her classmates?
A cookfire burns 9 logs every hour. It was built with 5 logs to start. If it gets 8 more logs added to it at the end of every hour, how many logs will be left after 11 hours?
Scott runs 6 miles every Monday through Wednesday. Then he runs twice as far he ran on Monday every Thursday and Friday. How many miles will he run in a month with 12 weeks?
